alert.note: Alert for Hartford; Middlesex (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 4:43AM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut... Connecticut River At Montague affecting Franklin and Hampshire Counties. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampshire and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County. Neponset River At Norwood affecting Suffolk and Norfolk Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut... Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Neponset River...including Norwood...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Hartford. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Flooding affects some residential areas below Hartford through Rocky Hill, including some roadways. Upstream of Hartford, flooding is likely to affect Windsor Locks, East Windsor and Windsor. Should localized evacuations be necessary, act quickly. Further downstream flooding will likely result in the evacuation of low lying area along River Road in Cromwell and Meadow Road in Portland. Flooding increases from Middletown and Portland to the river mouth at Old Saybrook. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:31 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 16.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:31 AM EST Tuesday was 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.0 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.0 feet on 04/13/1887. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued early this morning at 545 AM EST.
